intro: Clarkia superba, commonly known as the showy clarkia, is a flowering plant native to the western United States and southern Canada. It belongs to the family Onagraceae and is characterized by its striking, showy flowers that range in color from white to pink and red. The plant typically grows in open meadows, grasslands, and rocky areas, preferring well-drained soil and full sun. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its stems are upright and branched. Clarkia superba blooms from late spring to early summer, producing clusters of tubular flowers that attract pollinators like bees and butterflies.
